intro: Diascia nodosa, commonly known as the nodding diascia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces showy blooms throughout the warmer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Diascia nodosa is often cultivated as a garden plant for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
